identificationModule.briefTitle: Atrial Fibrillation (AF) Clinic to Improve the Treatment of Patients With Atrial Fibrillation.
identificationModule.officialTitle: The Effect of a Nurse-driven ICT-supported Disease Management Program to Improve the Treatment of Patients With Atrial Fibrillation.

responsibleParty.oldOrganization: Dept of Cardiology, Maastricht University Medical Center

descriptionModule.briefSummary:
* Randomized controlled trial comparing specialized AF Clinic with 'care as usual'
* Hypothesis: treatment of AF patients in the AF-Clinic by a nurse, specialised in AF, using guideline-based dedicated software, under supervision of a cardiologist, is efficient, safe and not inferior to care as usual by a cardiologists.

interventions.name: AF Clinic
interventions.description: Treatment of atrial fibrillation patients by specialized nurses, supervised by cardiologists, using dedicated software to ensure maximal adherence to AHA/ACC/ESC guidelines on atrial fibrillation treatment

interventions.name: Care as Usual
interventions.description: Routine clinical care of atrial fibrillation patients, provided by cardiologists, without the help of specialized nurses or dedicated software.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Composite of heart failure, thromboembolic complications, bleeding, severe adverse effects of drugs and death from cardiovascular causes.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: All cause mortality, all cause hospitalizations, Treatment (benchmarking) in accordance to the 2006 AHA/ACC/ESC guidelines in AF, quality of life, patient satisfaction, anxiety, depression, compliance and cost effectiveness.

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Newly diagnosed atrial fibrillation

Exclusion Criteria:

* Age \< 18 years
* unwillingness to participate
